conclusion: Analyze the given U-I graph and use the information provided by the lines a and b.
Line a intersects the U-axis at 3.6 V.
The open circuit voltage Uoc is 3.6 V.
Line a intersects the I-axis at 0.4 A.
The short circuit current Isc is 0.4 A.
The load resistance R is represented by line b.
The slope of line b gives the resistance R.
The slope of line b is calculated as ΔU/ΔI.
The slope of line b is 12.5 Ω.
Lines a and b intersect at U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.
The operating point is at U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.
The internal resistance r can be found using the formula r = (Uoc - U)/I.
Substitute the values to find r = 5.5 Ω.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell at this light intensity is 5.5 Ω.
